s.text: This study used antibody to myosin II from animals and Arabidopsis myosin VIII for immunofluorescence studies.

Insight into the function of plant myosins has been gained by studies in algae.
As actin is utilized by myosin for motility, the possible functions of myosin in plants are closely linked to the functions of actin.

Unlike most calmodulin-binding proteins, myosins bind calmodulin in the absence of Ca 2+.
These studies provide evidence that plant myosins bind calmodulin in the absence of Ca 2+and are active when calmodulin is bound and inactivated when the Ca 2+concentration is increased.
